newsitem.title: UK: UK regulators consider takeover law reform - paper.
newsitem.headline: UK regulators consider takeover law reform - paper.

text.p: British regulators are considering proposals which would make hostile takeover bids more difficult by restricting a bidder's ability to buy shares in the market, the Financial Times said on Tuesday.

The paper said leading figures from industry and The City were privately lobbying the Takeover Panel, which oversees the conduct of bids, for reforms up to and including an outright ban on the buying of shares by bidders.
The Financial Times said senior regulators had conceded that change looked likely.
Critics of the present system believed changes would be backed by a Labour government, said the paper.
